item.title: Publishers and brands, get ready for the Snapchat algorithm - Digiday
item.description:
Publishers and brands, get ready for the Snapchat algorithm - Digiday

Snapchat is developing an algorithm that will act as a gatekeeper between publishers and brands and their audiences, according to sources. Many publishers and brands are earmarking resources for Snapchat, the platform of the moment for reaching a large, young and active audience.

item.title: Google Home: A Smart Speaker With a Search Giant for a Brain
item.description:
Google Home: A Smart Speaker With a Search Giant for a Brain

MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. - Google on Wednesday introduced Google Home, a voice-controlled, Internet-connected speaker that competes directly with Amazon's smart speaker, Echo, which costs $180. The company also introduced Allo, a messaging app, and a rebranding of its virtual assistant. Here's a quick explanation of what these major announcements, made at the Google I/O developer conference, mean for consumers.

item.title: Why Bots Should Be More Like Plants and Less Like People - How We Get To Next
item.description:
Why Bots Should Be More Like Plants and Less Like People - How We Get To Next

The fact that plants are continuously monitoring their environment is what makes them interesting to Wright, and intriguing as a model for building networks of bots. But how do we translate plant communication into something we can understand as humans?

item.title: How Startups Are Using Virtual Assistants
item.description:
How Startups Are Using Virtual Assistants

sums it up perfectly: "When you're building a vision, a team and a product all at once, time is your ultimate currency. Every day presents both the opportunity to break ground and the risk of losing ground.

item.title: Introducing rich cards
item.description:
Introducing rich cards

Rich cards are a new Search result format building on the success of rich snippets. Just like rich snippets, rich cards use schema.org structured markup to display content in an even more engaging and visual format, with a focus on providing a better mobile user experience.

item.title: Florida court allows Google to be sued by publisher delisted as "pure spam"
item.description:
Florida court allows Google to be sued by publisher delisted as "pure spam"

Courts in the US have consistently held that search engines have almost total discretion over the content on their pages and ranking algorithms under the First Amendment of the US Constitution. This is a legal defense against companies bringing claims about the economic impact of ranking changes or Google's SEO-related policies.

item.title: Google App Indexing Replaced By Firebase App Indexing
item.description:
Google App Indexing Replaced By Firebase App Indexing

Today is Google I/O and I am spotting a some changes to the Google docs that have not yet been announced. It seems Google has renamed it's Google App Indexing to Firebase App Indexing. Firebase is a company Google acquired in October 2014 that makes products for software developers building mobile or web applications.

item.title: Google supercharges machine learning tasks with TPU custom chip
item.description:
Google supercharges machine learning tasks with TPU custom chip

Machine learning provides the underlying oomph to many of Google's most-loved applications. In fact, more than 100 teams are currently using machine learning at Google today, from Street View, to Inbox Smart Reply, to voice search. But one thing we know to be true at Google: great software shines brightest with great hardware underneath.
